Fish and bear paws—one can't have both.

foreignData.name: 森の熊
foreignData.type: クリーチャー — 熊

mainBoard.name: Forest Bear

mainBoard.flavorText: In establishing the Shu kingdom, Liu Bei's forces fought against Ma Chao at Chengdu. Eventually, Ma Chao surrendered and became one of Liu Bei's Tiger Generals.

mainBoard.name: Shu Cavalry

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn’t interact with flying or reach.

mainBoard.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

mainBoard.flavorText: Throughout the three kingdoms, important generals were often guarded by small groups of expert soldiers known as "elite companions."

foreignData.name: 蜀の近衛部隊
foreignData.text: 馬術（このクリーチャーは、馬術を持たないクリーチャーによってはブロックされない。）

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn’t interact with flying or reach.

mainBoard.text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

mainBoard.flavorText: Kongming's first campaign against the Wei kingdom was a rousing success until an arrogant Shu general, Ma Su, foolishly lost the city of Jieting.

foreignData.name: 蜀の精鋭歩兵部隊
foreignData.type: クリーチャー — 人間・兵士

mainBoard.name: Shu Elite Infantry

mainBoard.flavorText: Liu Bei lost many men at the battle of Runan because of his lack of strategy. It wasn't until he met Kongming that he began to truly succeed as a leader.

foreignData.name: 蜀の歩兵
foreignData.type: クリーチャー — 人間・兵士

mainBoard.name: Shu Foot Soldiers

mainBoard.flavorText: Keeping a million-man army fed was no easy task. Grain and rice caravans were the lifeblood of the empire.

foreignData.name: 蜀の輜重隊
foreignData.text: 蜀の輜重隊が戦場に出たとき、あなたは２点のライフを得る。
foreignData.type: クリーチャー — 人間・兵士

mainBoard.name: Shu Grain Caravan
mainBoard.originalText: When Shu Grain Caravan comes into play, you gain 2 life.
mainBoard.text: When Shu Grain Caravan enters, you gain 2 life.

mainBoard.flavorText: While defending their southern borders, both the Wu and Shu kingdoms fought against the barbarians' trained elephants.

foreignData.name: 南蛮の象
foreignData.type: クリーチャー — 象

mainBoard.name: Southern Elephant

mainBoard.flavorText: The overnight appearance of miles of "armed" Wu forts at Guangling frightened a much vaster Wei force into fleeing for their lives.

foreignData.name: わら人形の兵士
foreignData.type: クリーチャー — カカシ・兵士

mainBoard.name: Straw Soldiers

mainBoard.flavorText: After making the Peach Garden Oath, the three brothers raised an army of 500 youths to fight the Yellow Scarves rebellion.

foreignData.name: 志願民兵団
foreignData.type: クリーチャー — 人間・兵士

mainBoard.name: Volunteer Militia

mainBoard.flavorText: At the second battle of Ruxu, the brave Wu general Gan Ning raided Cao Cao's camp of 400,000 men with only 100 cavalry. Not a single man or horse was lost.

mainBoard.flavorText: A cunning strategist, Cao Ren tricked Zhou Yu by letting him enter Nanjun. Zhou Yu thought he was capturing the city until Cao Ren's arrows rained down upon him.

When Wu Scout enters, look at target opponent's hand.

mainBoard.flavorText: Kongming and Lu Su tricked Wei troops into shooting over 100,000 arrows at them to later use against the Wei at Red Cliffs.

foreignData.name: 十万本の矢集め
foreignData.text: 対戦相手１人を対象とする。そのプレイヤーがコントロールするタップ状態のクリーチャー１体につき、カードを１枚引く。
foreignData.type: ソーサリー

mainBoard.name: Borrowing 100,000 Arrows
mainBoard.originalText: For each tapped creature your opponent has in play, you draw a card.
mainBoard.text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.

mainBoard.flavorText: Sun Quan's long and successful rule in the years 199 to 251 was due to his ability to choose and foster talented advisors and generals.

foreignData.name: 幕僚団
foreignData.text: 幕僚団が戦場に出たとき、カードを１枚引く。
foreignData.type: クリーチャー — 人間・アドバイザー

mainBoard.name: Council of Advisors
mainBoard.originalText: When Council of Advisors comes into play, draw a card.
mainBoard.text: When Council of Advisors enters, draw a card.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Leadership, not numbers, determines victory."
—A Wu commander, before his 5,000 troops forced 15,000 Wei troops to retreat from Ruxu

foreignData.name: 強制撤退
foreignData.text: クリーチャー１体を対象とし、それをオーナーのライブラリーの一番上に置く。
foreignData.type: ソーサリー

mainBoard.name: Forced Retreat
mainBoard.originalText: Return any one creature from play to the top of its owner's library.
mainBoard.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

mainBoard.flavorText: The mourning families of commanders and generals were often given land, valuables, or money to compensate for their losses.

foreignData.name: 災難の補償
foreignData.text: クリーチャー１体を対象とし、それを破壊する。オーナーは４点のライフを得る。
foreignData.type: ソーサリー

mainBoard.name: Misfortune's Gain
mainBoard.originalText: Destroy any one creature. That creature's owner gains 4 life.

rulings.text: The creature's *owner* gains the life, regardless of who happens to control it.
A token's owner is the player who created it.

mainBoard.text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.

mainBoard.flavorText: Trip wire, hooked poles, and sunken pits were commonly used to unhorse riders during the Three Kingdoms period.

foreignData.name: 足絡めの罠
foreignData.text: 馬術を持つクリーチャー１体を対象とし、それを破壊する。
foreignData.type: ソーサリー

mainBoard.name: Trip Wire
mainBoard.originalText: Destroy any one creature with horsemanship.
